Вы до сих пор не играли в Bioshock?
Тогда вам повезло потому что,
Такого захватывающего сюжета вы (возможно) ещё никогда не встречали.
Считаю что биошок должны пройти все кто любит хорошие игры с хорошим сюжетом.
Персонажи прорисованны просто на 5+ .
Много непонятного и загадочного что ещё более захватывает.
А когда раскроете весь сюжет покроетесь мурашками и будете сидеть и смотреть часами в одну точку.
Если кому не жалко 999 рублей (можно и на скидках)  или хотите найти  достойную игру на прохождение то биошок это ваш выбор.
Итог:BioShock Infinite окунет вас на 4-5 дней в поисках приключений и поверьте мне и большей частью людей которые уже прошли биошок что вы останетесь очень довльны!!!
(Возможно вы впадете в небольшую депрессию после прохождение , это нормально просто поделитесь впечатлением своим друзьям и постарайтесь не оставаться одному )
Надеюсь этот обзор вас заинтересовал и вы пройдете его хоть даже и притаку,  но пройдете.
Будет что внукам рассказать)

This is so fucking boring holy shit

Recomendo,

   #Sobre o jogo em si: Pontos positivos: História bem complexa e interessante do jogo que tem um final muito bom, boa diversidade no arsenal com melhorias para cada arma, poderes de "VIGOR" Divertidos e ótimos no combate, jogo totalmente legendado para PT-BR.
    Pontos negativos: Ele é um jogo pouco desafiador e extremamente intuitivo (os pouquíssimos desafios lógicos no jogo são bem faceis mesmo de se resolver), qualquer um acostumado com jogos de tiro FPS vai virar ele sem muita dificuldade no nivel hard.

   #Graficos: joguei com os graficos no ultra e ainda assim grante parte dos objetos (principalmente os pequenos) apresentavam as e extremidades bem pixeladas, mas, os efeitos de agua, luz (luz direta e reflexos) e efeitos relacionado aos VIGORES estão bem bons mesmo.

   #Engine: Continua não muito atrativa, pois, os elementos do mapa permanesse quase totalmente intactos depois de um tiroteio insano (são quase nulos objetos destrutivos), elementos do mapa não são como os da Crytek ou source que são separáveis da do resto do mapa, por exemplo, no infinite tem um escrivaninha com varios elementos fixos nela que não vai acontecer NADA com eles mesmo depois de um tiro de bazuca direto nela.

   Minha nota final para ele é de: 8.5/10.

Picked it up on Sale becuase I always heard Bioshock games were really good. Little did I know of the ride I'd be sent on while playing this. Fun gameplay, Breath taking visuals, and a fantastic story that will leave you speechless at times and feeling emotions you didn't even know a game could give you.

I highly recommend this game. From the character you fall in love with to the quirkey steampunk setting to the mind blowing ending. Might be a couple years old, but if you haven't played it yet do yourself a favor and pick it up.

First of all, this is one of my favorite fps games that I had ever played. It looks great, has a very deep and engaging story, and can be a fun shooter. There was only one thing bad about the game.

I am going to try to explain this without any spoilers;

The games ending was very disapointing for me. Not story wise. Game play wise. The story ending was actually amazing. The thing is that I felt that the game was too short for what it was making it seem. Not all good games have to be long. Many are short like undertale or pony island and are still great. But for the whole game, I felt like I was building everything up for something huge. But the ending came unexpectedly for everything that you do. You are constantly upgrading you vigors and weapons, and choosing the right gun layout for what might come next and the final battle doesn't even feel final or like a big battle. It was actually my least favorite battle in the game. None of the skills or special things that you learn throughout the game are needed in the final battle and it felt very anti-climatic.

The game makes it feel like there is going to be this whole big thing that you will need to use all your skills for at the end but it is just another level. My full first play through where I explore every nook and crany took 10- 11 hours. I felt that it should have been more but the gameplay and story make it amazing anyway. So I reccommend it.

I haven't really played any 2K games besides 5 minutes of my brother's Borderland's 2. I don't know them well but I could tell this was similar to Borderlands 2, but I digress. This game is somewhat, unique and different(literally the same 2 adjectives) to any other game I've ever played. The thought that went into the story I have to say, is just, brilliant. They took on religion and racism but made it more 'interesting'. I LOVE the intro where you are introduced to the first weapon(melee thingy), IT'S F******G AWESOME. Combat is addictive, story is incredible, graphics are beautiful and somehow remind me of The Legend of Zelda(don't asky why) and the game is just generally addictive. I haven't played much but I can say, so far, that there isn't much combat but I do still enjoy listening to voxes and learning more about the game. I don't know about anyone else but I spend A S***T ton of time searching for things in crates,purses etc. It kind of gets annoying but if you want to find important items you might want to take a 'quick' look around. You also might experience a bit of back-tracking with chests and lock-pick chests(this can be frustrating).
Overall, it's a good(underexaggeration) game.
Combat: 9.5/10
Graphics: 9.8/10
Voice Acting: 10/10
Story: 10/10
Item Searching:7/10
AI: 8/10
Overall score: 9/10

I learned 3 things with this game. 

1) its rated 97% or something by game rankings for PCs
=> PCs are shit for gaming. Will buy a PS4 if i want to play. 

2) Its time for ratings to be segmented by age. the industry is mature enough. I want to play but can't be bothered with silly boring repettitive FPSs. The first Bioshock was intriguing and mysterious. It raised plenty of questions as to WHY. This just... you dont want to know. 

3) I dont think ill ever play FPSs again. Perhaps Halo bu that's it.

So after putting 50 hours into this game (keep in mind there's no multiplayer, no open world, no deep progression system, and is not particularly hard outside of the ridiculously impossible 1999 mode) I feel more than a little obligated to write this review. I can say without a doubt it is by far one of the best games I have ever played.
Everything about this game is incredible. The combat, story, voice acting, tone, and message are all powerful and carry weight. Combat is satisfying gunplay with a variety of weapons, combined with the Vigor (think basic spell casting) system. Vigors are unique, from simply throwing a fireball to a telekinetic wave to a water tendril. All Vigors can combo with each other, and casting multiple vigors while using multiple weapons is satisfying and strong, without making you feel like a god. Enemy variety is also solid, with "heavy hitters" requiring you to adjust your approach and not use gameplay aspects like skyrails as a crutch (example, Handymen can electrify skyrails to knock you off). A simple upgrade system is also present, allowing you to slightly modify the Vigor’s effects, as well as the damage, ammo capacity, and recoil of weapons.
The story is incredible. Yes, of course there is a twist, but the real strength comes from the world building. Colombia is detailed, with audio logs and dialogue filling in gaps. Colombia feels real because of this. 
There’s a ton of style, from the simply uniqueness of Colombia to the gorgeous looking weapons. It’s very steampunk, but weirdly colorful as well.
It should also be noted that the mood of the game is different than the Rapture games. It’s less horror-esque, and not as claustrophobic. Colombia is open, and lacks any type of fear that Bioshock or Bioshock 2 carried. Suspense is still present, simply through the multiple story arcs that I will not spoil here. Just know that social issues and moral conflicts are aplenty, from class conflict to the morality and necessity of violence to the dangers radical evangelicalism. 
Voice acting is incredible. The characters of Booker and Elizabeth feel genuine, and you can even notice character development and growth between them as the story progresses.
This wholesome experience is also enhanced by the emotionally powerful Burial at Sea DLC. This DLC is by far the single best DLC package I have ever played. It is masterfully executed, with a terrific story that hits hard, and gameplay that (while different from Infinite’s) brings back Bioshock’s original gameplay with limited ammo, and introduces a stealth based style with Part 2. 
You have to play this game. It was worth it at $60 and it’s a steal at $30.

The game in one word: AWESOME. The story setting is just breathtaking, the colors are very vivid and everything is combined with a very nice soundtrack, which will shake your heart and will let you fell a thrill in your spine. The story is so complex and hard to understand, and it ends with one of the more suprising end I have ever seen. When you see the outro of the game a lot of questions appear in your mind and you will start thinking about the whole story and not sleeping during the night :D.
The combat system is also quite good and first of all funny, and the game difficulty is also pretty balanced related in what you choose. I started the story in the hard mode, the most difficult I could choose, and I've to admitt that was a bit frustrating in some points like boss fights.
I would u really reccomend this game. My final mark is 10/10

也许我不在一个正确的时间点，玩了一个应该玩的游戏。

我觉得生化奇兵无限的问题在于，游戏有很多种类型，而生化奇兵就像电影，电影能讲的内容有限，但你把三个小时的电影拉成二十个小时，就成了国产垃圾连续剧，直接的体现就是糟糕的游戏性了。

惊人的美工，不合理的场景设计，不友好的收集设计，恰恰因为线性设计的路线试图填塞过多的场景内容，不会迷路但是会在来回奔波中添加过多焦虑感。

实际上我对一代的评价更高，因为游戏核心不一样：一代的核心是整个海底城的背景，主角是这座城而不是你控制的人；而则所有的心思都在你控制的人和史无前例的ai伊丽莎白身上，这就是我对于无限最多的意见，整个游戏都存在分裂的倾总是在糊弄要突出的东西，我全程都在看自己说什么，还伊丽莎白说了什么，但战斗起来用什么技能，如何去打，至少在我一周目的困难难度里无关紧要的，乏味，难以派上用场，以及无趣。这就很大程度上毁灭了以我自己为重心的代入感。

当然，这个游戏依然是神作，因为海葬dlc的存在，划了一个完美的循环，才算是一个拥有回响的故事。

也许是我玩的太晚了，也许只是我不该在刚用200多个小时通关巫师3以后，再来玩这个游戏。

这个游戏想表达的完美，在今天却早已被超越了。

也从各个角度来说，我觉得2亿美元打造这个游戏，还是浪费了太多的资源。

BioShock Infinite — явление по меркам шутеров неординарное. В десять — пятнадцать часов игрового времени утрамбовано невероятное количество событий, и обо всех очень хочется рассказать, вот только боишься испортить первое впечатление. В отличие от исходного BioShock, сюжет которого был почти полностью построен на обмане игрока, здесь обманчива сама система морали. Даже после прохождения не получится назвать персонажей добрыми или злыми — мотивы поступков и их последствия сплетаются в такой тугой клубок, что разматывать его придется несколько прохождений и множество часов горячих дискуссий на форумах. Пожалуй, по духу игра больше всего походит на цикл книг о Геральте Анджея Сапковского — только здесь дилеммы не выведены столь откровенно, а схватившее тебя за шиворот Зло не шипит на ухо: «Выбирай!» Раньше в BioShock всегда было ясно, хорошо ты поступаешь или не очень. В Infinite же вообще сложно заметить миг, когда ты делаешь выбор, — да и не понятно до конца, делаешь ли вообще. В целом оценка 10 из 10.

Tras rejugarlo no me queda otra cosa que acabar por comentar la obra maestra de irrational por antonomasia , una IA increible con unos comentarios que te mantienen inmerso en la historia durante la totalidad de esta , haciendo que todos nos enamoremos de la joven Elizabeth , acabando con una trilogia de la mejor manera posible con un final que solo aquellos jugadores que se hayan adentrado en las calles de columbia saben a lo que me refiero  , poniendo a infinite como el juego que todo amante , no de los shooter , cualquier aficionado de los videojuegos ha de aventurarse en esta magnifica historia y dejarse invadir por esta autentica obra de arte audiovisual , UNA AUTENTICA MARAVILLA "no tengo miedo de dios pero de ti si"

Masterpiece 10/10

Overall, -35.  I would recommend this game only on sale.  It was extremely linear in its convoluted and arbitrary story path.  You can only save games at checkpoints, but you can die pretty much infinitely with no real issues.  So, the save game restriction just makes it harder to stop playing when you want.

-1, unskippable intro.
+1, .ini fix for unskippable intro

-38, 38 seconds of unskippable intro and the gaul to think ANYONE should need to see that intro EVERY TIME YOU START.

+10 Stunning visuals.  Wow, amazing graphics.

-3 Stunned at game progression.  Wow, can you say linear.

-1 Save games.  1, and only 1.

-1 Death?  Pah!  Who cares?  It doesn't actually negatively affect the game in any way.  Die, lose a bit of cash, and start in exactly where you left off.

-3 Random item placement.  I have gathered 300 coins digging in dumpsters and just picking it up off the ground.  Not to mention other random items stuffed all over the place.  "Not realistic" doesn't quite apply to Bioshock games, but WTF?  It would be the equivilent of me finding 20 bills and stacks of 5.56 ammo every 200 feet while walking down a street.

-1 Randomly placed gigantic voice recorders.  Why are they there? What possible reason is there for random joe to make a voice recording and then leave it in a random location?

-1 Random placement of gigantic voice recorders that pop up in the same (exact same, not alternate universe same) place I've already been. Who put those there?  Angels?

-1 Incredible shift of vocal tone.  
      Female: "I'm mad at you, you tried to kill me."  
   5 seconds later, 
      me: Can you help with this lock?"
      Female: "Sure, no problem!"
   What?  Weren't you just running from me and yelling to get away?

+5 If stoned, this game would be awesome.  
       Me: Why did X happen?
         Stoned me: It just did man.  Roll with it.  
       Me: Ok.. how about Y?
         Stoned me: Dude.  Chill.  It just did, man.
